intro: Macrochiton lessertianum, commonly known as the lesser macrochiton, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and typically display shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas.
